org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.impl

Class EventBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.impl.EventBuilder

  • public class EventBuilder
extends Object
    Build audit Events, and maybe be found to be a more convenient method to building audit events than crafting them manually from Field instances.

    Note that this class provides several convenience methods to add frequently used fields to an audit event. The names under which these fields will be stored in the event can be configured through the configuration object provided in the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setField

        public final EventBuilder setField(String name,
                                   byte[] value)
        Set a new field in the event with the specified properties.

        The method creates a defensive copy of the provided audit data (the byte[] value), and stores the copy in the event. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field to set
        value - The value of the field to set
        Returns:
        The event builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When value is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When value is empty

      • setField

        public final EventBuilder setField(String name,
                                   char[] value)
        Set a new field in the event with the specified properties.

        The method creates a defensive copy of the provided audit data (the byte[] value), and stores the copy in the event. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Note that the value of the provided char is encoded using the charset specified in CommonProperties.getEncoding()

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field to set
        value - The value of the field to set
        Returns:
        The event builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When value is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When value is empty

      • setField

        public final EventBuilder setField(Field field)
        Set a new field in the event.

        The method creates a defensive copy of the provided audit data (the content of Field), and stores the copy in the event. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Parameters:
        field - The field to set
        Returns:
        The event builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When value is null

      • setEventType

        public final EventBuilder setEventType(char[] value)
        This method sets a field that represents an event type.

        This is a convenience method if applications want to use this field, and also want to use the standard field name for it. If you want to set a different field name for this field, you should use the generic setField(Field) method.

        The field is named according to the well-known field names defined in CommonProperties as provided at creation of this object, the value for the field is taken from the provided parameter.

        The method creates a defensive copy of the provided audit data (the char[] value), and stores the copy in the event. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Note that the value of the provided char is encoded using the charset specified in CommonProperties.getEncoding()

        Parameters:
        value - The value of the field to set
        Returns:
        The event builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When value is null
